decks.notes: The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game by disrupting opponent's strategy with counterspells, removal, and hand disruption while deploying efficient threats to apply pressure. The synergy between disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal options like Fatal Push, creates a tempo advantage for the player. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The combination of disruptive elements and efficient creatures like Troll of Khazad-d√ªm and Murktide Regent allows for a proactive gameplay style that aims to close out the game quickly.

The key concept of the deck is to utilize tempo plays and disruption in order to control the game while applying pressure through aggressive creatures. By using cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to disrupt the opponent's strategy, combined with cards like Daze and Force of Will to counter key spells, the deck aims to maintain control of the board while steadily advancing its own game plan. With efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, as well as card draw and selection from Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck can adapt to various game states and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly assemble a powerful board state. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana, utilize card draw and manipulation to find combo pieces, and then use Mystic Forge to cast spells from the top of the library. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for important artifacts and disrupt opponents. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently using artifacts and combo synergies to generate a strong advantage and potentially win the game in a few turns.

The central theme of this deck revolves around quickly and efficiently getting powerful creatures onto the battlefield through the use of cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to ramp, the deck aims to cheat in high-cost creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty. Additionally, the inclusion of Omniscience allows for casting spells for free once it is on the battlefield, greatly increasing the deck's combo potential. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game quickly.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also runs a suite of counterspells such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal options like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. The mana base includes a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. It also utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm for card selection and control elements like Pyroblast and Force of Will for protection. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Magus of the Moon and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponents' strategies and disrupt mana bases. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a win through milling or control.

The deck focuses on creating a combo using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. It uses cards like Shuko and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to enable the combo quickly. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's game plan. It has a toolbox land package with Urza's Saga to find key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo efficiently while controlling the game.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. Cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for the pieces you need, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember help clear the way for your creatures to attack. The deck utilizes a mix of tempo and aggro strategies to control the board and outmaneuver your opponent, ultimately aiming to win the game quickly and decisively.

This Aggro Dragon Stompy deck focuses on utilizing powerful one-drop artifacts and creatures to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's mana base. With aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf, coupled with disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure while locking down the opponent's lands. The deck's explosiveness is further highlighted by the ability to ramp into the game-ending spells such as Sundering Eruption. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory quickly.

This deck focuses on using infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent, leading to an alternate win condition. It utilizes efficient mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and disruption cards like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces while cards like Berserk and Invigorate provide additional ways to pump up the infect creatures for a quick win. The deck also includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to smooth out draws and find key pieces quickly.

Control the game by disrupting your opponent's plans with counterspells and removal spells while setting up your own win condition. Use Teferi and Narset to control the board and dig for more answers with Brainstorm and Ponder. Temporary Lockdown and Dress Down can shut down troublesome creatures or strategies, while Prismatic Ending and Swords to Plowshares deal with threats efficiently. L√≥rien Revealed and Forth Eorlingas! provide additional protection and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until you can close it out with your powerful spells.
